qas.question: When did the torch arrive in Canberra?
Who received the flame from Chinese officials in Canberra?
What did Agnes Shea give to the Chinese in return?
Who publicly argued at a press conference?
Where was the relay held in Australia?
How many kilometers was the route in Australia?
What was the location of the beginning of the Olympic torch route in Australia?
What is the name of the Aboriginal elder who received the torch from Chinese officials?

context: Australia: The event was held in <a4_0>Canberra<a4_0/>, Australian Capital Territory on <a0_0>April 24<a0_0/>, and covered around <a5_0>16<a5_0/> km of Canberra's central areas, from <a6_0>Reconciliation Place<a6_0/> to Commonwealth Park. Upon its arrival in Canberra, the Olympic flame was presented by Chinese officials to local Aboriginal elder <a1_0><a8_0>Agnes Shea<a8_0/><a1_0/>, of the Ngunnawal people. She, in turn, offered them <a2_0>a message stick<a2_0/>, as a gift of peace and welcome. Hundreds of pro-Tibet protesters and thousands of Chinese students reportedly attended. Demonstrators and counter-demonstrators were kept apart by the <a7_0>Australian Federal Police.<a7_0/> Preparations for the event were marred by a disagreement over the role of the Chinese flame attendants, with <a3_0>Australian and Chinese officials<a3_0/> arguing publicly over their function and prerogatives during a press conference.
